alert.note: Alert for Colfax; Mora (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued June 16 at 6:15PM MDT until June 16 at 9:15PM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: The National Weather Service in Albuquerque has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... The Cooks Peak burn scar in... South Central Colfax County in northeastern New Mexico... North Central Mora County in northeastern New Mexico... * Until 915 PM MDT. * At 615 PM MDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing locally heavy rain over the Cooks Peak Burn Scar. Between 0.25 and 0.75 inches of rain are estimated to have already fallen. Additional rainfall amounts of 0.25 to 0.75 inches are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. Excessive rainfall over the burn scar will impact Rivera Mesa into Sweetwater Creek. The debris flow can consist of rock, mud, vegetation and other loose materials. HAZARD...Locally heavy rainfall in and around the Cooks Peak Burn Scar. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Life threatening flash flooding and possible debris flows in and around the Cooks Peak Burn Scar. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Miami. State Route 569. This includes the following highways... Interstate 25 between Mile Markers 403 and 411. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Runoff from rainfall will cause elevated water levels within vulnerable drainages in and downstream of the Cooks Peak wildfire burn area. To report flooding, contact the National Weather Service office at 1.888.386.7637 when you can do so safely.
